description: A fully object-oriented approach to JSON manipulation, validation, and serialization that focuses on modeling the JSON structure rather than mere string parsing.
releaseNotes:
See Trello board for this project at https://trello.com/b/bQ7Io1z9/manatee-json.  Feedback is welcome through the board, on StackOverflow, or by emailing littlecrabsolutions@yahoo.com.

If you use this library for a business, you can let the world know on the aforementioned Trello board.

v3.1.5
BUG FIX: Enum schema not parsing properly.

v3.1.4
BUG FIX: Number formatting should use InvariantCulture.

v3.1.3
BUG FIX: JsonArray.GetIndentedString() outputs null when array is empty.
BUG FIX: JsonObject.GetIndentedString() outputs null when object is empty.
BUG FIX: JsonPath expression support for unary minus (negator).
BUG FIX: JsonPath comparative operators not working.

v3.1.2
Extended transform logic.

v3.1.1 
BUG FIX: JsonTransformer doesn't handle literal arrays. 

v3.1.0 
Added transforms based on https://www.npmjs.com/package/jsonpath-object-transform 
Added SchemaFactory.FromType<T>(). 

v3.0.4
Added bug fix from 3.0.2 back in.

v3.0.3
Signed assemblies

v3.0.2 & 3.0.2.1
BUG FIX: Number parsing failing when using stream and number is at end of object or array.

v3.0.1.1
Rebuilt and repackaged.  No functional changes.

v3.0.1
BUG FIX: Nested JSON types not parsing correctly (e.g. objects inside arrays).
BUG FIX: Can't handle long string data.  (Now supports up to 28K characters.)
BUG FIX: Numbers always expect ',' after, causing error when number appears at end of array or object.

v3.0.0
Significant performance improvements:
    Testing based on 10K iterations parsing and deserializing an array of basic objects
        (2.6GHz, i7-372QM, 8GB RAM, 64-bit Win7 Enterprise)
    - v2.8.9 : 52s - 56s
    - v3.0.0 : 1.6s - 1.7s
title: Manatee.Json
